docs.snippet: Through the funds, companies scout for new products or services and business partners, but critics say the funds contribute to inflated valuations....
docs.lead_paragraph: Through the funds, companies scout for new products or services and business partners, but critics say the funds contribute to inflated valuations.
docs.abstract: More older, established companies such as General Mills and 7-Eleven are joining tech firms to create venture capital funds in effort to look for new products and potential business partners; moves have led to surge and peak in value of many venture capital-backed start-ups.

headline.main: General Mills and 7-Eleven Join the Venture Capital Crowd
headline.print_headline: As More Companies Invest in Start-Ups, Soft Market Poses a Test
